title: London Tube rides go high tech
teaser: Starting soon, London Underground riders will be able to enjoy WiFi and other services.
contenttemplated:
[{"type":"text/html","content":"

Extreme hairdo owner and London Mayor Boris Johnson announced big changes this week for London's subway system, the Underground. Besides train service running 24 hours a day, Tube riders will soon be able to enjoy WiFi service. Also coming: a way to pick up things you bought online in old ticketing offices. BBC tech correspondent Mark Gregory tells Marketplace Tech about the new changes.

"}]
description: Starting soon, London Underground riders will be able to enjoy WiFi and other services.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, November 22, 2013
contentencoded: Extreme hairdo owner and London Mayor Boris Johnson announced big changes this week for London's subway system, the Underground. Besides train service running 24 hours a day, Tube riders will soon be able to enjoy WiFi service. Also coming: a way to pick up things you bought online in old ticketing offices. BBC tech correspondent Mark Gregory tells Marketplace Tech about the new changes.
